candidates.title: Cleanup of Resolve trait in API
Zenoh 0.6.0-beta.1
candidates.body: This PR merges into master all the changes developed for the Zenoh 0.6.0-beta.1.

candidates.title: Update all dependencies
Implement reply filtering based on intersection with query, as well as escape hatch
zenoh-ext: add QueryingSubscriber::allowed_origin()
candidates.body: Following #322, we also need a `allowed_origin(Locality)` operation for the `QueryingSubscriber`.

candidates.title: Define exclusiveness of the serial transport
seal the plugins module and mark it as unstable
candidates.body: Since we might be planning changes to plugins (possibly removing the `Runtime` from their signatures), marking them as `unstable` makes sense.

candidates.title: Add plugins versions logs
candidates.body:
Add logging (debug) of versions for REST and StorageManager plugins.
This will help analysis in case of incompatibility between `zenohd` and those plugins.

candidates.title: Mark locality management types and operations unstable
Lowlatency
candidates.body:
This PR proposes a new implementation on the transmission pipeline with the goal of reducing the overall latency.

Few numbers comparing the perfs on a test machine equipped with an AMD Ryzen 7 5800X 8-Core Processor.

# Throughput

## Legacy
```
luca@c18:~/zenoh$ ./target/release/examples/z_pub_thr 8 --no-multicast-scouting -e tcp/127.0.0.1:7447 -p 5
```

```
luca@c18:~/zenoh$ ./target/release/examples/z_sub_thr --no-multicast-scouting -l tcp/127.0.0.1:7447 -s 10 -n 1000000
4267262.089694375 msg/s
4274242.895555417 msg/s
4273369.790191731 msg/s
4278778.324924178 msg/s
4285796.3219784545 msg/s
4273432.556539959 msg/s
4284028.97931403 msg/s
4273578.421916209 msg/s
4276858.756388868 msg/s
4280948.733584059 msg/s
```

## New
```sh
luca@c18:~/mallets-zenoh$ ./target/release/examples/z_pub_thr 8 --no-multicast-scouting -e tcp/127.0.0.1:7447 -p 5
```
```sh
luca@c18:~/mallets-zenoh$ ./target/release/examples/z_sub_thr --no-multicast-scouting -l tcp/127.0.0.1:7447 -s 10 -n 1000000
4212208.04206722 msg/s
4243165.87324203 msg/s
4245018.259882369 msg/s
4250149.05060213 msg/s
4240312.124965594 msg/s
4245346.324591207 msg/s
4249325.03296244 msg/s
4239366.46704027 msg/s
4253503.138396249 msg/s
4250568.406197477 msg/s
```

# Latency

## Legacy

```sh
luca@c18:~/zenoh$ ./target/release/examples/z_pong --no-multicast-scouting -l tcp/127.0.0.1:7447
```
```sh
luca@c18:~/zenoh$ ./target/release/examples/z_ping 8 --no-multicast-scouting -e tcp/127.0.0.1:7447 -w 1 -n 10
Warming up for 1s...
8 bytes: seq=0 rtt=38µs lat=19µs
8 bytes: seq=1 rtt=39µs lat=19µs
8 bytes: seq=2 rtt=38µs lat=19µs
8 bytes: seq=3 rtt=39µs lat=19µs
8 bytes: seq=4 rtt=38µs lat=19µs
8 bytes: seq=5 rtt=39µs lat=19µs
8 bytes: seq=6 rtt=37µs lat=18µs
8 bytes: seq=7 rtt=39µs lat=19µs
8 bytes: seq=8 rtt=37µs lat=18µs
8 bytes: seq=9 rtt=39µs lat=19µs
```

## New
```sh
luca@c18:~/mallets-zenoh$ ./target/release/examples/z_pong --no-multicast-scouting -l tcp/127.0.0.1:7447
```
```sh
luca@c18:~/mallets-zenoh$ ./target/release/examples/z_ping 8 --no-multicast-scouting -e tcp/127.0.0.1:7447 -w 1 -n 10
Warming up for 1s...
8 bytes: seq=0 rtt=31µs lat=12µs
8 bytes: seq=1 rtt=25µs lat=12µs
8 bytes: seq=2 rtt=26µs lat=13µs
8 bytes: seq=3 rtt=25µs lat=12µs
8 bytes: seq=4 rtt=26µs lat=13µs
8 bytes: seq=5 rtt=25µs lat=12µs
8 bytes: seq=6 rtt=26µs lat=13µs
8 bytes: seq=7 rtt=26µs lat=13µs
8 bytes: seq=8 rtt=25µs lat=12µs
8 bytes: seq=9 rtt=25µs lat=12µs
```

candidates.title: Anti-entropy protocol
candidates.body: This PR looks into aligning multiple key-value stores subscribing to the same key expression. Addressing https://github.com/eclipse-zenoh/roadmap/issues/43

candidates.title: Allow build of zenoh artifacts with specified features
candidates.body:
This PR updates the `Cargo.toml` files for `zenohd`, `examples` and `zenoh-ext` crates.
Now all the features are re-exported, thus allowing compilation only of the needed dependencies.

This solves #302, thus now Zenoh can build on FreeBSD.

Now this works.
```
$ cargo build --bin zenohd --example z_pub --example z_sub --no-default-features --features transport_tcp
...
Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.16s
```

candidates.title: Privatize zenoh net and rationalize prelude
Serial (RS232-like) transport for Zenoh
candidates.body:
Hi, this PR contains a transport for Zenoh over Serial ports (RS232-like), it builds atop [Zenoh Serial Framing](https://github.com/ZettaScaleLabs/z-serial) to provide a datagram-based non-reliable abstraction to the Zenoh transport layer.
Wire-encoding leverages on [Consistent Overhead Byte Stuffing (COBS)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consistent_Overhead_Byte_Stuffing).

Sister PR of https://github.com/eclipse-zenoh/zenoh-pico/pull/100

candidates.title: WIP: Keyexpr refactor and some method renaming
Providing the WebSocket transport
candidates.body:
This PR provides an implementation for a WebSocket-based transport for Zenoh routers, clients and peers.

- [x] Choice of a locator format `ws/<address>:<port>`  
- [x] Implement the traits for the WebSocket transport: `LinkUnicastTrait`, `LinkManagerUnicastTrait` 
- [x] Add the relevant tests

The feature is disabled by default but the tests can be run with:
```bash
$  cargo test -p zenoh-transport --no-default-features --features transport_ws
```

candidates.title: Configuration updates: New rustfmt.toml file and new "fast" Cargo profile
candidates.body:
The `rustfmt.toml` configures `rustfmt`. The following options are provided:

```toml
edition = "2018"
use_try_shorthand = true
use_field_init_shorthand = true
```

The fast profile is an addition to builtin debug and release profiles. It's intended to build fast binaries with less compile time, and provide verbose debug information. In order to use the "fast" profile, 

```sh
cargo test --profile fast
```

candidates.title: A dedicated executor for TX
candidates.body: This PR adds a dedicated executor for TX in such a way RX tasks don't eventually block the async runtime for TX.

candidates.title: Internal tidy of async/await types and traits towards runtime agnostic code
candidates.body:
It's my effort to make zenoh to be less async-std dependent and adopt more runtime-independent types. This patch reduces the usage async-std types in flavor of futures and std. The std is Rust standard, while futures crate is yet to be standard.

* Replace `async_std::sync::{Arc, Weak}` with std's.
* Remove futures-lite crate in flavor of futures crate.
* Use `StreamExt`, `AsyncReadExt` and `AsyncWriteExt` from futures crate. The only exception is `async_std::prelude::FutureExt` because many places uses `FutureExt::race()` and `FutureExt::timeout()`.

candidates.title: fix --cfg behaviour being broken with commas
zenohd Debian service: add config file (close #191)
candidates.body:
This PR adds the following to the **zenohd** debian package:

- a `/etc/zenohd/zenohd.json5` config file which is used by the `zenohd` service.
- a `/var/zenohd` directory which is used as `$ZENOH_HOME` by the `zenohd` service. (i.e. persistent storages will be created under this directory)

candidates.title: WIP Storage manager cfg refactor
candidates.body:
This contains the changes discussed in #220, as well as:
- a small refactor to the ValidatedMap accessors for `Config` and `Notifier<Config>` which should make writing generic code over these two easier
- debugging plugin misloads should be easier with the now better error messages

This PR needs sister PRs in each backend, working on that, and I'll run some checks before removing the WIP

repo.name: zenoh
repo.description: zenoh unifies data in motion, data in-use, data at rest and computations. It carefully blends traditional pub/sub with geo-distributed storages, queries and computations, while retaining a level of time and space efficiency that is well beyond any of the mainstream stacks.
